conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the initial acceleration of block A.
Two wooden blocks A and B are connected by a light spring.
Block A is pulled vertically upward by a constant force until block B just leaves the ground.
Block A is above block B with a spring in between.
Initially, the system is at rest.
Identify the forces: weight of block A, upward force, and spring force.
Initially, the net force on block A is zero.
Spring force equals the weight of block A.
With the applied force, the new net force on block A is F - mg.
Using Newton's second law, F = ma for block A.
Calculate initial acceleration: a = (F - mg) / m.
Simplify to get a = F/m - g.
The magnitude of the initial acceleration of block A is F/m - g.
